channel.title: Questions!
channel.description:
1. Now when i use an bucket of water on a pot of flour i get an pie dish. But how can i do that when i use an bucket of water on an pot of flour, i can chose out pastry dough, bread dough, and the other one what i don't know the name of. But i hope you understand. I mean the 3 doughes u can get a runescape too when u use water on an pot of flour.
2. Is it impossible to get wheat on MoparScape?

item.description:
@I_Hawk_I wrote:

Quite possibly… im not entirely sure, haven’t really had to add picture options.

item.title: Questions!
item.dc:creator: @xweetok599 xweetok599
item.description:
@xweetok599 wrote:

I doesn’t add dough. You can choose to make bread dough etc. I think it’s something about sendframe.

Read full topic

item.title: Questions!
item.dc:creator: @I_Hawk_I I Hawk I
item.description:
@I_Hawk_I wrote:

I understood what you were after, and this is a simple form of what you wish to do.
Let me explain what my code does:

lets say item 1 is water and item 2 is pot of flour.

if water is used with pot of flour or vice versa
and if player meets the skill level requirement
then delete water and pot of flour
and add dough and some skill experience
and player proceeds with animation.

If player does not meet required level, send message “You must have at least ___ to make that”

Now, I know this doesn’t cover being given a choice of what you wish to make, but it gives you a starting point to work from, what you would need to do from here, is to add the selection interface for the doughs, then make it so you can select how many of the dough you want.

Read full topic

item.title: Questions!
item.dc:creator: @xweetok599 xweetok599
item.description:
@xweetok599 wrote:

I don’t mean that if u use water on the three of them that u get something.
I mean that if u use an bucket of water on an pot of flour,
you can choose out pizza base, pastry dough and bread dough. That when u press pizza base, it will make pizza base. And if u press pastry dough, it will make pastry dough. So that u can click on what u want to make.

Read full topic

item.title: Questions!
item.dc:creator: @I_Hawk_I I Hawk I
item.description:
@I_Hawk_I wrote:

  1. This is an example of what you might use. With explanation. This can go somewhere in client.java
if ((itemUsed == ##) && (useWith == ##) || (itemUsed == ##) && (useWith == ##)) { if (playerLevel[##] >= #) { deleteItem(###, getItemSlot(##), #); deleteItem(###, getItemSlot(##), #); addItem(####, #); addSkillXP(##, #); setAnimation(####); } else { sM("You must have at least ___ cooking to make that"); } }

Item 1
Item 2
Skill ID
Level requirement
Delete Item 1
Delete Item 2
Amount of Item
Added item e.g Dough
Amount of added item
Experience gained
Skill ID
Animation
Message sent when item is created

If you wanted to add multiple options, like: Bread | Brown Bread | Green Bread… or whatever you would have to add an interface, and make it so that
if interface button # is pressed —> Proceed in making item

  1. If you mean Grain… then the item ID is 1947

Read full topic
